705404f-a.title: Brooklyn: Lenox Road - Flatbush Avenue
705404f-a.text:
(1)
Lenox Poad, south side, between Flatbush and Bedford ..ves.
March 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing the Lenox Street Baptist Church in 1868, occupied
No. 42 Lenox Road, which was groperty formerly occupied by the First
M.E. Church of Flatbush and for a short period by the Universalist
Church of Divine Love. Its subsequent changes as to denominations
are as follows1- 1872, Church of St. Barnabas, Lutheran; 1908,
Parkaide Church, Presbyterian; 1917, Church of the Redeemer, Lutheran.
1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
705404f-a.folder: Lenox Road & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

705405f-a.title: Brooklyn: Lenox Road - Flatbush Avenue
705405f-a.text:
Lenox Road, south side, between Flatbush and Bedford Aves., showing
the Lutheran Church of the Redeemer, Wo. 42, and right next to it
(in a state of demolition), its parsonage at No. 34.
April 23, 1929.
Eugene LL. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing the church in process of demolition.
April 30, 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, showing final demolition.
May 11, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
705405f-a.folder: Lenox Road & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704261f-a.title: Brooklyn: Flatbush Avenue - Lenox Road
704261f-a.text:
Flatbush Ave., south from Lenox Road. (Gen'1. Phil Crooke's home
occupied the site at the right, upon which are seen the 1-story buildings).
July 1928.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704261f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Lenox Road, Brooklyn, NY

705400f-a.title: Brooklyn: Lenox Road - Flatbush Avenue
705400f-a.text:
21 Lenox Road, north side, east of Flatbush Ave. A view of a Chapel
probably built by Dr. Jackson of St. Mark's Episcopal Church of Flatbush in
1908, and named the Church of the Holy Apostles. It subsequently became a
garage, and was finally demolished, in 1929.
April 23, 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
705400f-a.folder: Lenox Road & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

705402f-a.title: Brooklyn: Lenox Road - Flatbush Avenue
705402f-a.text:
Lenox Road, east of Flatbush Ave.
1897.
Eugene L. Armbruster Cellection.

705403f-a.title: Brooklyn: Lenox Road - Flatbush Avenue
705403f-a.text:
56 Lenox Road, south side, between Flatbush and Bedford Aves.
May 11, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
